851699613:
[

Hospital Specialist Representative

Company Name Bayer Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 113 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Bayer, a passion for enhancing patients’ lives is what motivates us every day. Our values – LIFE (Leadership, Integrity, Flexibility and Efficiency) guide us in our work, and inspire us to go above and beyond; for each other, our customers and the communities we live in.

Our General Medicine team lives these values and Xarelto, our leading cardiovascular product, is entering an exciting growth phase as a result of ongoing research and development. We are expanding the size of our sales team nationally and opportunities exist to join Bayer and realise our commitment to deliver for a better life for patients in our community

The Role
As a HSR with Bayer General Medicine you will be empowered to make a difference in the lives of patients through the promotion of our cardiovascular product Xarelto to hospital-based and private practicing specialists, within a designated territory of North and West Melbourne.

As a new HSR member of our team, you will be exposed to a comprehensive training program that combines technical product training and sales techniques to ensure that you have the necessary repertoire of professional skills to succeed at Bayer. This role presents a significant opportunity for success, given the market position of our product Xarelto, our willingness to invest in our future, and the support and focus provided by our leaders.
Who you are
\xa0
To be successful in this role, you will be a driven, results focussed individual who sets high professional and personal standards.
Your personal attributes will include:

  • Courage to learn and innovate
  • Strategic mindset to influence and challenge customers respectfully
  • Leadership qualities that allow you to collaborate and succeed in a team

Suitable candidates for this role will be experienced sales representatives with knowledge of therapeutic areas in either general medicine or specialty medicine. Candidates who have sold at both GP and Specialist level will be considered, while previous measurable achievements will demonstrate your ability to step up and succeed in this role. Experience in any other following roles will be considered: GP Representative, Specialist Representative, Pharmaceutical Representative.

Your application
Bayer offers competitive compensation and benefits programs. If you meet the requirements of this unique opportunity, and you have the "Passion to Innovate" and the "Power to Change", we encourage you to apply now.
\xa0
For any questions regarding our internal recruitment process or employee referral program, please contact the Bayer Talent Acquisition team on 02 9391 6071.
\xa0
PASSION TO INNOVATE | POWER TO CHANGE
\xa0
Bayer is an Equal Opportunity Employer

850716921:
[

Assistant Store Manager

Company Name Kitchen Warehouse Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 43 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you looking for an exciting new opportunity?


We are moving into your neighbourhood and are looking for new team members including an Assistant Manager.

\xa0

Come and join Australia's #1 kitchenware Retailer, Kitchen Warehouse. \xa0With a successful chain of stores in WA and Australia's biggest kitchenware website we have now expanded onto the East Coast and there is an opening for an Assistant Store Manager to be part of our passionate team.\xa0\xa0


We are Kitchenware retail specialists located in large format retail outlets.\xa0 Our stores are unique and designed with fully operating kitchens so we can educate our customers through ongoing events and activities. We surprise and delight our customers with the sheer volume of kitchenware products on offer.


Our Assistant Store Managers are required to demonstrate leadership and inspire excellence from the staff located in their business.\xa0 You will need strong communication skills,\xa0 the ability to develop a cohesive and enthusaistic team and achieve service levels that exceed all expectations.


An interest in cooking and entertaining will be well regarded but not a necessity.\xa0 \xa0


The Assistant Store Manager will report to the Retail Manager and the key responsibilities of the role are to:

  • Ensure the team are delivering a high level of customer service.
  • Drive sales to achieve targets.
  • Have a strong understanding of rosters, wages and productivity.
  • Manage stock levels and inventory movement.
  • Manage staff development and motivation.
  • Be able to maintain visual merchandising standards to company guidelines.
  • Assist in the management of store administration.
  • Be an ambassador for the Kitchen Warehouse brand.


The ideal Candidate will be:

  • A dynamic team leader that is hands on and not afraid to lead by example, be willing to work both on the shop floor and the warehouse.
  • Enthusiastic, energetic and passionate.
  • Experienced in managing a large amount of stock.
  • A strong communicator.
  • Organised and reliable with excellent time management skills.
  • Dedicated to excellent customer service.
  • Available to work retail trading hours 7 days a week.
  • Able to produce a Police Clearance (3 months or less)


If this sounds like you, take the first step to starting a new career with a brand where you can reach your full potential. Apply Now!

To apply, a cover letter must be included outlining why you feel you are suitable for this role on the details above.

Please email your cover letter and CV to ShaneTimmins at areamanagervic@kitchenwarehouse.com.au

[

Senior Systems Engineer (Wintel)

Company Name Officeworks Company Location 1 South Drive 236-262 East Boundary Road, East Bentleigh, VIC 3165, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 217 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Systems Engineer (Wintel) to complement our overall I.T Platforms Team.


Reporting directly to the Team Leader your primary responsibilities in this role include:

  • Build, procure, deploy, and support Officeworks Wintel environment;
  • Provide 2nd and 3rd level support for Officeworks store and support office based IT infrastructure;
  • Assist and support the IT Support teams, which includes ensuring knowledge articles are kept up to date and training opportunities are identified and performed;
  • Design, develop and implement security initiatives driven out of the IT security team


With a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar position, specifically focused on providing incident resolution in a timely manner, your proactive nature, coupled with your ability to provide exceptional customer service to both internal and external stakeholders will see you succeed in this role.


Based at the Officeworks Support Office in East Bentleigh, this role provides critical support to our vast network of stores, warehouses and support offices. It is an important part of ensuring our customers can make bigger things happen.


The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate previous experience in the following:

  • IT Infrastructure technical knowledge specifically
    • Store Solutions
    • Security and redundancy
    • Large scale, complex and distributed business environments
    • Windows desktop and server technologies including Desktop Applications
    • Print Technologies
    • Remote Support
    • SOE Design, development and deployment
    • Software packaging and deployment
    • PowerShell scripting skills mandatory
    • Mobility i.e. Phone, ActiveSync, Portable Data Terminals, MDM platform Airwatch.
    • Microsoft Exchange, Office 365, LANDESK (or equivalent), Active Directory
    • Building, patching and supporting all internal hardware, remote site-based servers, workstations and network infrastructure;


If you believe you have the skills and experience required to succeed in this role, we would like to hear from you.

849603772:
[

SEO Manager

Company Name Columbus, a Merkle Company Company Location South Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 61 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

WHO WE ARE:\xa0


Columbus, a Merkle Company, is a data-driven marketing agency, leading brands from today to tomorrow. Our talented team partner with clients to deliver end to end people-based brand experiences through a world-class data narrative. Through our expert navigation of data, pioneering strategy and passion for what we do, we bridge the gap between your business and the people you want to talk to, truly understanding the segment of one.


ROLE OVERVIEW:\xa0

This is a client-facing role, charged with delivering end to end SEO solutions for some of the country’s leading brands.
A deep understanding of SEO and the organic search landscape is a must, highly effective communication skills, understanding a client’s business, strategic insight & delivery, are all critical elements to success in this role.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Create & implement complete SEO strategies, encompassing all relevant SEO products, using effective workflow techniques across projects in order to meet deadlines, manage workloads to a very high quality\xa0
  • Drive strategic SEO solutions where possible leveraging first, second and third party data to improve SEO results
  • Work with SEO and Content Specialists to execute and implement client recommendations including, code creation, page speed improvements, custom HTML implementation and meta data \xa0
  • Understand clients’ business challenges they face and align with client leads to drive tangible business outcomes
  • Effectively manage a team of SEO specialists ensuring a high standard of work at all times
  • Collaborate with internal teams ensuring SEO results are articulated and communicated with key stakeholders
  • Work with client developers and in-house teams to implement recommendations
  • Plan and allocate team resource across SEO client portfolios
  • Identify areas for development and put in place clear plans to help you and your team achieve their development goals and career roadmap within Dentsu Aegis Network.
  • Deliver insightful client reporting with clear actionable insights, recommendations and competitor analysis
  • Responsible for ensuring that invoicing and other financial processes are followed accurately and punctually.\xa0
  • Provide clear & reliable financial forecasting to the Client Solutions Director.


SKILLS AND ATTRIBUTES:

  • 4+ years’ experience in SEO
  • Understanding of the latest SEO strategies, techniques and best-in-class examples
  • Proven track record of managing & developing successful SEO campaign
  • Strong working knowledge of SEO tools and platforms
  • Comfortable with main web analytics tools and analyzing data to derive insights
  • Working knowledge of HTML, JavaScript & CSS, & an understanding of server-side concepts such as PHP, ColdFusion, .Net


At DAN, a diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work, and be proud of doing so. \xa0For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.
